intro: Cassipourea ndando, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically red or yellow when ripe. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and timber quality, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
